description: UPS Critical Alarm.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlV11upsCritical TRIPPLITE-MIB::upsTrapCode i 9999 TRIPPLITE-MIB::upsTrapDescription s EXAMPLE

description: A numeric code identifiying the condition that caused the trap to be sent.
If the trap number is 104 (upsAgentStarted) or 105 (upsAgentStopped), this
code will indicate whether the SNMP agent is software (1) or hardware (2).
variables.name: TRIPPLITE-MIB::upsTrapCode

description: The description of the trap.
variables.name: TRIPPLITE-MIB::upsTrapDescription

description: This trap is sent each time an alarm is inserted into
to the alarm table.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsTrapAlarmEntryAddedV1 TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmId i 9999 TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmDetail s EXAMPLE TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmDeviceId i 9999 TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmDeviceName s EXAMPLE TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmLocation s EXAMPLE TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmGroup i 1

description: A description of the alarm condition.

description: A textual description of the alarm condition.
variables.name: TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmDetail

description: A numeric identifier for the device on which the alarm is active.

description: A string identifier for the device on which the alarm is active.
variables.name: TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmDeviceName

description: The location of the device on which the alarm is active.
variables.name: TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmLocation

description: The category/group of this alarm.
variables.name: TRIPPLITE-MIB::tlUpsAlarmGroup

description: Used to inform another entity of an engine's startup. The varbinds that follow are:
OBJ1 = tlEngineType
Obj1Value = The type of engine providing this data
OBJ2 = tlEngineSoftwareVersion
Obj2Value = The current version of the engine
OBJ3 = tlEngineMACAddr
Obj3Value = The MAC address of the engine
OBJ4 = tlUpsSnmpCardSerialNum
Obj4Value = The serial number of the SNMPWEBCARD [should be 0 on PC]
--- if this trap is extended, place all static OIDs above this mark. all objects below
--- the number of devices (tlNumDevices) is explicit as per device for enumeration by
--- the target receiver
OBJ5 = tlNumDevices
Obj5Value = The number of devices attached
--- The following objects will be replicated per each device:
OBJ6 = The OID for an entry of tlDevManufacturer, indexed by device
Obj6Value = The device's manufacturer
OBJ7 = The OID for an entry of tlDevModel, indexed by device
Obj7Value = The device's model name
OBJ8 = The OID for an entry of tlDevName, indexed by device
Obj8Value = The device's display name
OBJ9 = The OID for an entry of tlDevLocation, indexed by device
Obj9Value = The device's location
OBJ10 = The OID for an entry of tlDevRegion, indexed by device
Obj10Value= The device's region
OBJ11 = The OID for an entry of tlDevProtocol, indexed by device
Obj11Value= The device's protocol (display string format)
Used to inform another entity of an engine's startup. The varbinds that follow are:
OBJ1 = tlEngineType
Obj1Value = The type of engine providing this data
OBJ2 = tlEngineSoftwareVersion
Obj2Value = The current version of the engine
OBJ3 = tlEngineMACAddr
Obj3Value = The MAC address of the engine
OBJ4 = tlUpsSnmpCardSerialNum
Obj4Value = The serial number of the SNMPWEBCARD [should be 0 on PC]
--- if this trap is extended, place all static OIDs above this mark. all objects below
--- the number of devices (tlNumDevices) is explicit as per device for enumeration by
--- the target receiver
OBJ5 = tlNumDevices
Obj5Value = The number of devices attached
--- The following objects will be replicated per each device:
OBJ6 = The OID for an entry of tlDevManufacturer, indexed by device
Obj6Value = The device's manufacturer
OBJ7 = The OID for an entry of tlDevModel, indexed by device
Obj7Value = The device's model name
OBJ8 = The OID for an entry of tlDevName, indexed by device
Obj8Value = The device's display name
OBJ9 = The OID for an entry of tlDevLocation, indexed by device
Obj9Value = The device's location
OBJ10 = The OID for an entry of tlDevRegion, indexed by device
Obj10Value= The device's region
OBJ11 = The OID for an entry of tlDevProtocol, indexed by device
Obj11Value= The device's protocol (display string format)
